data.title: Great Pizza!
data.text: Thin crust pizza with a somewhat crunchy crust cut in small squares with plenty of toppings.  Great pizza re-heated too, if you buy oversized.  I think pricing of medium pizza with 2 salads and drinks is a bit pricy at $32, but pizza is awesome and we go monthly.

data.title: Pizza King Junkie
data.text: Always love these places, no matter where they are located.  Usually family run outfits, they serve consistent food across the chains and always leave me searching for another corner piece.

data.title: Delicious thin crust pizza! A central Indiana tradition!
data.text: I love Pizza King and have since I was a child in Marion, Indiana. They are famous for their thin crust round pies. Our personal fav is sausage, pepperoni, and light BBQ sauce. Treat yourself!

data.title: Simply the Best!
data.text: I have tried other pizza places throughout the Carmel/Indianapolis area & by far, this is the best.  The ingredients are always fresh & delicious.  The sausage & pepperoni are both ground fine & loaded on top of your pizza.  We always get our pizza here & have never been disappointed.  The staff is friendly, helpful & always welcoming!  Try a dine in or carry-out.  You'll be happy you did.

data.title: Way overpriced pizza
data.text: Our family likes the flat crust crispy style of Pizza King but this one was way overpriced.  The pizza was good but we paid almost $50 for two large two topping pizzas.  We won't be returning.

data.title: The best pizza in Carmel
data.text: Is unmistakably the best pizza to be had in Carmel.  Slightly more expensive, but worth it.  Should be your first pick in Carmel.

data.title: Always delicious
data.text: Usually order carry out.  It's always ready on time & hot even when I get it home.  The toppings are all delicious, especially my favorites of sausage & pepperoni.  They are both finely ground & there is plenty of them.   Other pizzas have a few circles of pepperoni & are just ok.  This Pizza King ALWAYS delivers the best ingredients baked in a perfect combination of sauce & toppings.  They are a little more expensive than other locations but by far they are the BEST!  You get what you pay for & it's worth it to enjoy this location of Pizza King.

data.title: Overpriced
data.text:
Recently ordered a 16 in. pepperoni and sausage pizza from this Carmel store
The good news is the pizza tasted very good.  The bad news is it cost me over $27.00 with no tip.
with so many choices of pizza in Carmel with $20.00 being top price for a large pizza.this price is outrageous!!!!!

data.title: Great Take Out/Delivered Pizza
data.text: Pizza King is an Indiana franchise.  No big doughy crust here with lots of toppings.  Like the Royal Feast which uses finely crumbled sausage.  It is cut into small squares which is great for those with children or for serving at a party

data.title: ROYAL FEAST
data.text: We miss pizza King and the Royal Feast and always enjoy one when we are in the area. Brings back many memories

data.title: Always delicious!
data.text: You just can't beat the quality of the ingredients at this Pizza King.  We have enjoyed their pizzas for many years & have NEVER been disappointed.  The sausage is crumbled up fine & adds a spicy flavor.  The pepperoni is the same, small crumbles.  I'm sure that adds to the excellent taste.  It is a little more expensive than other pizza chains ($9.86 for a 10" sausage & pepperoni) , but it is SO worth it.  The Carmel location is conveniently located in a small strip center just west of Keystone on Carmel Drive.
